Hey man

I know how you feel, tilt is the hardest part of League to deal with, even the pros sometimes can't get their heads around it for months on end. Luckily for you, your career doesn't depend on getting off tilt, so you can take it casually. 

Here's what I think might help:

+ **Take a break for a bit.**
 Maybe go only ARAM or normals for a while, or take a complete break from the game for about a week. Only come back to ranked when your attitude is good, if you're finding yourself going;

 _"I can't win with this player"_
_"Top got too fed gg"_
_"How is this team so bad..."_

 Then you're not ready for ranked.

+ **Focus on improving, not winning.**
 Winning doesn't get you anywhere in the long-run. If you win heaps of games but don't improve, you'll just drop back to your original rank after you climb for a bit.

 The focus needs to be on improving. Play back your replays and analyse them, you'll notice that as a spectator you can look at your play more critically to find mistakes. Use [OP.GG](http://oce.op.gg/summoner/userName=CHEESYLEEKS) and [replay.gg](http://www.replay.gg/) to get your replays. 

 If you want more help on replay analysis look for a guy on the forums called **Yasei Doubutsu**, he does great bronze gameplay analysis. I follow him closely, and the tips he gives are more than enough to get you into silver.

 Here's a link to his analysis series [here](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Bc1tFkCS66U&list=PLyCEt27AsZuvNu0RQiCwgV2j3tR4foqvI&index=12).

+ **Find some friends.**
 I don't know how you've made it this far without friends to be honest, but you need to find some. Even just casual friends you can fall back on for some normals after a bit of a ranked loss streak.

 If you see someone with a good attitude in-game, try and add them, see if you can play a few more matches together. Or add some players who carried you in a game, see if they can help you improve.

+ **Look to the streamers.**
 Find some streamers/youtubers with a positive attitude (not Gross Gore). I'd personally recommend [gbay99](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rAsU0e_VVz0). You should be able to learn a bit from them, hopefully their good attitude will rub off a bit on you.

I hope this helps.

Oh, I forgot to add, if you're dead-set on leaving League, then I'd recommend trying [Arena of Fate](https://www.arenaoffate.com/) for PC or [Vainglory](http://www.vainglorygame.com/) for tablet. They are the most casual anti-tilt MOBAs on the market.

Make sure you try everything along the way though, there's some other great MOBAs that you might end up connecting with.

Can I say that I am seeing more and more players come onto the forums with the exact same issue OP has?

I have only been here since the start of S6 stating the same as OP, this advice, means nothing. I have had S scorecards and loses, that should not be the case, nor should I be losing any LP or rank when I play that well.

The current state of rank at low levels is just a joke, that is all it is, from the players who have ZERO idea how to play the game, let alone do better than shit in ranked, to those who blatantly give no shits and only want to play that specific champion regardless of anything, the rank system at low levels is not working.

I recently explained something similar to what you're asking in detail on a different post. If you want to see the discussion that happened, you can find it [here](http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-strategy/1ErgEln1-ranked-results-needs-to-be-change?comment=00020000000000000000).

Alright onto your answer, I'll keep it short ;)

+ The main problem with your misunderstanding is that you think **Good KDA = Win** so when you end a game with S class rank but lost, you feel like the system just cheated you.

 **The system rewards strategies that win**, not strategies that get good KDA's or CS. That's because the objective of the game is to** kill the nexus**, not other champions, minions or even turrets (technically).


> The current state of rank at low levels is just a joke, that is all it is, from the players who have ZERO idea how to play the game, let alone do better than shit in ranked, to those who blatantly give no shits and only want to play that specific champion regardless of anything, the rank system at low levels is not working.

I'm not surprised ahah, it's low elo after all right? Of course the players will be inexperienced and make poor decisions.

If anything I'd say the ranked system is working perfectly. The low elo players are in low elo. If these people were playing against challenger players, then we would have a problem.

> If anything I'd say the ranked system is working perfectly. The low elo players are in low elo. If these people were playing against challenger players, then we would have a problem.

Now that's a scary thought..

I'm sorry but all I see is "blah blah blah", someone with a fancy green forum title trying to justify why Riot can't make a fair ranked system.

I have heard it all before, I have tried it all before, I can go full tank, be with my team all the time, help them out as much as possible in team fights and whatnot, go full damage and try to win that way, or anything in between.

The short of it is this; You MUST rely on your team to currently gain LP, MMR, wins and most important, LP.

That is in no way fair for anyone of us. I have had games with the most stats period across the board, including assists, showing that I was in fact playing with the team and trying my best to help them, but lost. Why? You figure this out, most damage done AND taken along with least deaths.

I had a game not too long ago:
Most: Damage done, taken, kills, assists
Least: Deaths
Took: 6/7 turrets and an inhibitor
Solo Baron and all our dragons
But lost.

Why? Team fight starts and my team fail, they can't position themselves, they can't hit the right targets, they don't know how or when to split push, they can't farm CS, you name it, it happened. Is that fair? No, but no doubt you will say it was.

> You MUST rely on your team to currently gain LP, MMR, wins and most important, LP.

Yes, this is a core element in the design of MOBA's in general. Teamwork is nessesary to win.

> I have had games with the most stats period across the board, including assists, showing that I was in fact playing with the team and trying my best to help them, but lost. Why? You figure this out, most damage done AND taken along with least deaths.

I stated before that KDA or stats doesn't win you games. You need to dispel the notion that it does.

There's many reasons as to why you lost. Maybe you; only went for kills? Didn't get the team to be proactive? Were not dynamic enough? Didn't address strong enemy players while they were manageable?

+ Sometimes you will get games where you played really well, but you got unlucky and your team was tilted or not as good as the enemy. Other times you'll get games were someone just carries for you, or the enemy is really bad and it feels like a bot game.

 In the long run it balances itself out. 

 In fact, assuming** you're not the problem** you have a 44% chance of getting a troll or noob player, while the enemy has a 56% chance. The chances are even lower for you to get 2 bad players.

I'd recommend watching gbay99's video on this.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5MTO2a7ZFcc

I hope this cleared any misunderstandings.
